variation.description: xsl:element: name=foo, namespace=""
xsl:element: output an element from xslt, name="foo", namespace="bar"
xsl:element: output one element with a child element both have same namespace value
xsl:element: output an element with child and grand child, parent name="foo" ns="bar" child name="x" ns="y" grand child name="I" ns="j"
xsl:element: test that parent ns is not inherited to child, parent name="foo" ns="bar" child name="x"
xsl:element: test that only the top most element will have the namespace specified for multiple level of element with same namespace.
xsl:element: output element with name=international characters (Japanese, Chinese)
xsl:element: using Attribute value template, name="{.//first-name }" and many other combination tests
xsl:element: name=" in valid name a:a:b " (error case)
xsl:element: outptut element with character entity reference and different types of child nodes
xsl:element: with namespace attribute but no name attribute (error case)
xsl:element: namespace is not a syntactically legal uri (actually, any character is OK in namespace)
Bug fixes #47284: XSLT: create:element with xmlns="" output unnecessary output

variation.name: Element_ElementWithEmptyElementTag
variation.description: Use a source (and correspond xslt 'match') of nested elements with the same name, and an empty element. [Bug 53290]

variation.name: Element_ElementWithNoNameSpecified
variation.description: Use xsl:element with name="" [Bug 53195]

variation.name: Element_ElementWithNoNameSpecifiedButValidNS
variation.description: Use xsl:element with name="", and valid namespace [Bug 53195]

variation.name: Element_ElementWithNSFromNameFn
variation.description: Use xsl:element with name="{name(.)}" from a base xml document that has a QName name with attached NS [Bug 53218]

variation.name: Element_UseXslElementWithNameSpaceAttrEqualToXmlnsUri
variation.description: Use xsl:element with a namespace attribute on the xsl:element element that corresponds to the xmlns Uri. Should generate an error. [Bug 54232]

variation.name: Element_UseXslElementWIthNamespaceEqualToXmlnsUri
variation.description: Use xsl:element with a namespace equal to the xmlns reserved namespace/uri. Should generate an error. [Bug 54232]
